intro: Memecylon fianarantse, commonly known as the Madagascar memecylon, is a small evergreen shrub native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
